channel.title: Riddles
channel.description:
i new some riddles that i thought would be cool to put on here.
Your stuck in a 30 by 30ft box and all the walls roof and floor are imposible to break, and on each wall there are mirrors lots of them there is also a wooden table in the middle of this box and a 1inch hole to breath out of....how do you escape?

item.title: Riddles
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

[quote=“Dboi, post:344, topic:69145”]Here’s A good one…

There are 2 ducks in front of 2 other ducks.
There are 2 ducks behind 2 other ducks.
There are 2 ducks beside 2 other ducks.

How many ducks are there?[/quote]
The Answer: Four Ducks.

[][]
[][] That’s one complex puzzle…

How is it possible, check this out.:
There are 2 ducks in front of 2 ducks. -> [][]
[hr]
---------------------------------------> [][]
There are 2 ducks behind 2 ducks.------^^^
Now, this is probably the part that got you all confused.
There are 2 ducks ‘BESIDE’ 2 ducks.
Now, that needs common sense. An object cannot be beside two items, it has to be beside 1 item.
For example, [ITEM 1][ITEM 2]
ITEM 1 and ITEM 2 are besides each other, so an object can’t be beside both of them.
This is fairly tricky, as your knowledge may thing an object can be beside 2 or more objects, but think again.
Maybe on of the only ways I can think of is having an object in the middle, which is beside two other objects.
If you get it, good for you.
So, two ducks can’t be beside two ducks.

Now for nicodk, and for some sense for everyone:
There are many meanings to operate. Riddles, just need common sense. To operate. The doctor cannot operate his son, because he is injured. The doctor cannot operate his son, because he is dead. The doctor cannot operate his son, because he is too lazy. The doctor cannot operate his son, because it wasn’t his son. The doctor cannot operate his son, because the head doctor can only operate on certain spots, such as the head. Riddles are made for challenging the brain, therefor it can have millions, and millions of answers. You can bring that to the common riddle, ‘Why did the chicken cross the road?’. There is billions, maybe even googles of answers. Riddles are to tease the brain, in my thought, it makes the teller of the riddle feel good, as for he can make millions of answers for the riddle, and his pray has chances and chances, and if the teller is not the good riddle-teller kind, he can switch the answer over and over again. Riddles are just for fun, and they should stay that way.

You may not understand much or anything I have said, because everything you think of at first turns into a ‘maybe’ or an ‘about’.
Also because maybe you are not understanding which type I’m using.
ex for ‘The doctor cannot operate his son, because he is injured’.
As I have told you, there are many meanings to operate, and in that current sentence I’m using the ‘Operating the boy’ as in ‘Operating the machine’.
It can be hard to understand things.

Then on, Riddles Rock!
[hr]
Here’s one:

If half of 5 were 3, what would one-third of 10 be?

This isn’t a trick question-_-

Read full topic

You have according to his instructions, 2 inftont of another 2, and 2 behind 2, and 2 beside 2,

Laying it out it would look something like this

[ ] [ ] - This is your first 2
[ ] [ ] -This is your next set of 2
Then choose a side and you find a set of 2 next to another set of 2, yes?
